org.sakaiproject.site.impl

Class SiteAliasCleanupNotificationAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.site.impl.SiteAliasCleanupNotificationAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationAction

    public class SiteAliasCleanupNotificationAction
extends Object
implements NotificationAction
    Removes orphaned aliases when a site is deleted. Only deals with site aliases and not, for example, mail archive channel aliases.
    Author:
    dmccallum

      • init

        public void init()
        Registered this NotificationAction with the NotificationService. Typically invoked by DI framework.

      • notify

        public void notify(Notification notif,
          Event event)
        Removes all aliases targeting the resource associated with the given Event. Use setPropagateExceptions(boolean) to control whether or not failures are just logged or are wrapped and raised as unchecked exceptions.

        Please note that the implementation assumes the configuration is correct such that this method only receives site deletion events. No guards are implemented in that respect.

        Specified by:
        notify in interface NotificationAction
        Parameters:
        notif - The notification responding to the event.
        event - The event that matched criteria to cause the notification.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Is site alias cleanup enabled. If not, simply ignores all events. Otherwise, will attempt to remove all aliases scoped to the deleted site. Aliases scoped to entities/resources associated with the site, e.g. a mail channel, need to be cleaned up elsewhere.
        Returns:

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Toggle alias cleanup behavior on and off.
        Parameters:
        enabled -
        See Also:
        isEnabled()

        public AliasService getAliasService()

      • isPropagateExceptions

        public boolean isPropagateExceptions()
        If true, notify(Notification, Event) will raise unchecked exceptions as is and wrap and rethrow checked exceptions. Otherwise such conditions are just logged.

      • setPropagateExceptions

        public void setPropagateExceptions(boolean propagateExceptions)
        Control failure handling in notify(Notification, Event).
